javadoc:
Container class for storing objects sorted on a long key. Uses the
 RedBlack Tree algorithm to store the objects.

methods.javadoc: Returns the number keys in this set.
methods.name: size
methods.comment: Returns the number keys in this set.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if the key is in the set.
@param key the key whose presence is to be tested.
methods.name: containsKey
methods.comment: Returns true if the key is in the set.

params.name: key
params.comment: the key whose presence is to be tested.

methods.name: get
methods.comment:
Returns the object value for the given key or null if the key
 is not in the tree set.

params.name: key
params.comment: the key whose associated value is to be returned.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the value object for the smallest key in the set that is greater than
 or equal to the given key. Returns -1 if
 there are no keys greater than or equal to the given key.
@param key the search key.
methods.name: getAtOrAfter
methods.comment:
Returns the value object for the smallest key in the set that is greater than
 or equal to the given key. Returns -1 if
 there are no keys greater than or equal to the given key.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the value object for the largest key in the set that is less than
 or equal to the given key. Returns -1 if
 there are no keys less than or equal to the given key.
@param key the search key.
methods.name: getAtOrBefore
methods.comment:
Returns the value object for the largest key in the set that is less than
 or equal to the given key. Returns -1 if
 there are no keys less than or equal to the given key.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the first key in this set.
@exception NoSuchIndexException thrown if no keys exist in this tree.
methods.name: getFirst
methods.comment: Returns the first key in this set.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the last key in this set.
@exception NoSuchIndexException thrown if no keys exist in this tree.
methods.name: getLast
methods.comment: Returns the last key in this set.

methods.name: getNext
methods.comment: Returns the smallest key in the set that is greater than the given key.

methods.name: getPrevious
methods.comment:
Returns the largest key in the set that is less than the given key. Returns -1 if
 there are not keys less than the given key.

methods.name: put
methods.comment: Adds the given key,value pair to this tree.

params.name: key
params.comment: the key with which the object is to be associated.

params.name: obj
params.comment: object to be associated with the specified key.

methods.javadoc:
Removes the given key from the set.
@param key key whose mapping is to be removed from the map.
methods.name: remove
methods.comment: Removes the given key from the set.

params.name: key
params.comment: key whose mapping is to be removed from the map.

methods.javadoc: Removes all keys from the set.
methods.name: removeAll
methods.comment: Removes all keys from the set.

methods.javadoc:
Test if the set is empty.
@return true if the set is empty.
methods.name: isEmpty
methods.comment: Test if the set is empty.

return.comment: true if the set is empty.

methods.javadoc: Returns an iterator over all the objects stored in this tree.
methods.name: iterator
methods.comment: Returns an iterator over all the objects stored in this tree.

methods.javadoc: Returns the color of the given node.
methods.name: colorOf
methods.comment: Returns the color of the given node.

methods.javadoc: Returns the parent of the given node.
methods.name: parentOf
methods.comment: Returns the parent of the given node.

methods.javadoc: Sets the color of the given node to the given color.
methods.name: setColor
methods.comment: Sets the color of the given node to the given color.

methods.javadoc: Returns the left child of the given node.
methods.name: leftOf
methods.comment: Returns the left child of the given node.

methods.javadoc: Returns the right child of the given node.
methods.name: rightOf
methods.comment: Returns the right child of the given node.

methods.javadoc: From CLR
methods.name: rotateLeft
methods.comment: From CLR

methods.javadoc: From CLR
methods.name: rotateRight
methods.comment: From CLR

methods.javadoc: From CLR
methods.name: fixAfterInsertion
methods.comment: From CLR

methods.javadoc: Delete node p, and then rebalance the tree.
methods.name: deleteEntry
methods.comment: Delete node p, and then rebalance the tree.

methods.javadoc: From CLR
methods.name: fixAfterDeletion
methods.comment: From CLR

methods.javadoc: Swap the linkages of two nodes in a tree.
methods.name: swapPosition
methods.comment: Swap the linkages of two nodes in a tree.

methods.javadoc: Save the state of the TreeMap instance to a stream (i.e., serialize it). @serialData The size of the TreeMap (the number of key-value mappings) is emitted (int), followed by the key (Object) and value (Object) for each key-value mapping represented by the TreeMap. The key-value mappings are emitted in key-order (as determined by the TreeMap's Comparator, or by the keys' natural ordering if the TreeMap has no Comparator).
methods.name: writeObject
methods.comment:
Save the state of the TreeMap instance to a stream (i.e.,
 serialize it).

methods.javadoc:
Reconstitute the <tt>TreeMap</tt> instance from a stream (i.e.,
 deserialize it).
methods.name: readObject
methods.comment:
Reconstitute the TreeMap instance from a stream (i.e.,
 deserialize it).

methods.name: buildFromSorted
methods.comment:
Recursive "helper method" that does the real work of the
 of the previous method.  Identically named parameters have
 identical definitions.  Additional parameters are documented below.
 It is assumed that the comparator and size fields of the TreeMap are
 already set prior to calling this method.  (It ignores both fields.)

params.name: level
params.comment: the current level of tree. Initial call should be 0.

params.name: lo
params.comment: the first element index of this subtree. Initial should be 0.

params.name: hi
params.comment:
the last element index of this subtree.  Initial should be
	      size-1.

params.name: redLevel
params.comment:
the level at which nodes should be red.
        Must be equal to computeRedLevel for tree of this size.

methods.javadoc:
Find the level down to which to assign all nodes BLACK.  This is the
 last `full' level of the complete binary tree produced by
 buildTree. The remaining nodes are colored RED. (This makes a `nice'
 set of color assignments wrt future insertions.) This level number is
 computed by finding the number of splits needed to reach the zeroeth
 node.  (The answer is ~lg(N), but in any case must be computed by same
 quick O(lg(N)) loop.)
methods.name: computeRedLevel
methods.comment:
Find the level down to which to assign all nodes BLACK.  This is the
 last `full' level of the complete binary tree produced by
 buildTree. The remaining nodes are colored RED. (This makes a `nice'
 set of color assignments wrt future insertions.) This level number is
 computed by finding the number of splits needed to reach the zeroeth
 node.  (The answer is ~lg(N), but in any case must be computed by same
 quick O(lg(N)) loop.)

name: LongRedBlackTree
comment:
Container class for storing objects sorted on a long key. Uses the
 RedBlack Tree algorithm to store the objects.
